Tools description.message: Webmaker tools ធ្វើ​ឲ្យ​វា​មាន​ភាព​ងាយស្រួល​ក្នុង​ការ​បង្កើត​វត្ថុ​នៅ​លើ​បណ្ដាញ។ បង្កើត​ទំព័រ​បណ្ដាញ​ផ្ទាល់ខ្លួន​របស់​អ្នក, វីដេអូ​អន្តរ​សកម្ម, ការ​បញ្ចូល, កម្មវិធី​ចល័ត និង​ជា​ច្រើន​ទៀត — ការ​សិក្សា​ពី​យន្តការ​បណ្ដាញ, កូដ និង​ជំនាញ​ផ្សេង​ទៀត​ដែល​អ្នក​មាន។
Tools description.description: a description of the webmaker tools

Making is the basis of everything we do..message: Making is the basis of everything we do. Try remixing one of our starter resources, or make something from scratch using X-Ray Goggles, Thimble, or Popcorn Maker. Then share it with the world using hashtag #webmaker.

Receiving your opinions on the Webmaker.message: Receiving your opinions on the Webmaker experience is important to us. In fact, your feedback is the first thing we take into account when we plan future improvements to the site. Please take a minute to tell us what you like about the site, what doesn’t work how you expected it would and what could be better.

Mozilla is a nonprofit organization.message: Mozilla is a non-profit organization and these open-source tools are created by a global community. They will always be 100% free—now and forever!

Our team uses an issue tracker called Bu.message: Our team uses an issue tracker called Bugzilla for filing bugs and monitoring fixes. Anyone can submit a bug. And just because it’s called a “bug” doesn’t necessarily mean there’s something wrong; it can be an idea you have for a feature, a note about how much you like something or a non-technical suggestion for improvements.

make-learn-teach-section-info.message: The Webmaker community gets together at events around the world—at libraries, community centers, internet cafes, or in your own living room. Find an event near you, learn how to host your own, or get involved with our global Maker Party (July to Sep 2014).

connect in many ways..message: We’re a big community and we connect in many ways.

Events desc.description: Copy for second square in contribute grid on explore

Mentoring is a chance to share your know.message: ការ​ណែនាំ​ត្រូវ​បាន​ផ្លាស់ប្ដូរ​ដើម្បី​ចែករំលែក​ចំណេះដឹង ហើយ​ផ្ដល់​មតិ​ត្រឡប់​ដោយ​ផ្ទាល់​ចំពោះ​អ្នក​សិក្សា​ទាំងអស់​នៅ​ជុំវិញ​ពិភពលោក​ដែល​ចង់​បាន​ជំនាញ​​​ឌីជីថល។

Opportunities to get involved.message: The Webmaker team periodically posts opportunities for people to test our site, tools and training resources. To get involved participate in one of our many community testing sessions, visit the wiki page for more information.
Opportunities to get involved.description: copy to encourage people to get involved in testing

Discover creative ways to teach and lear.message: Discover creative ways to teach and learn digital superpowers
Discover creative ways to teach and lear.description: Heading for first explore subsection with map

Suggest a resource for.message: ស្នើ​ធនធាន​សម្រាប់ {{ skill.term }}

Thimble Desc.message: បង្កើត​នឹង​បោះពុម្ភទំព័រ​វេបសាយ​របស់​អ្នក​
Thimble Desc.description: Make and publish your own web page.

We all use the web in different ways..message: We all use the web in different ways. Mozilla is dedicated to helping you build a web that’s relevant to your friends, family, business or community—no matter where you live.
We all use the web in different ways..description: Value description for local on home page

The web is yours.message: វិប​គឺជារបស់អ្នក

We’re always eager to learn how Webmaker.message: We’re always eager to learn how Webmaker is used to teach the web to diverse audiences. If you have stories about using Webmaker in your community, please join the Webmaker newsgroup and share your feedback by email. You can also participate in conversations on Twitter by replying to @webmaker or using the hashtag #teachtheweb.
We’re always eager to learn how Webmaker.description: copy encouraging people to get involved on Feedback

Popcorn Maker Desc.message: បង្កើត​វិដេអូ​ដែល​ទាក់​ទង​គ្នា​។

active daily discussion paragraph.message: នេះ​ជា​ការ​ពិភាក្សា​ប្រចាំថ្ងៃ​សកម្ម​ជា​ច្រើន​ដែល​អ្នក​អាច​ជួយ​ចែករំលែក​​ទិសដៅ​នៃ​គម្រោង​​របស់ Webmaker ។

Do you have a web literacy project?.message: Do you have a web literacy project? We’d love to hear about it and potentially share it on Webmaker.org.
